entities.description: "REACTOME is a database that provides information on interactions between proteins, as referenced in the text."
"DRUGBANK is a database mentioned in the text, which contains information about drugs and their interactions."
"SWISSPROT is a protein database that is referenced in the text for exact matches of drug or human protein names."
WIKIHOP is a dataset used for evaluating model performance in an open-domain setting, with both standard and masked setups to assess the ability of models to rely on context rather than lexical cues.

MEDHOP is a dataset used for evaluating model performance, specifically in the context of drug interactions, with both standard and masked setups to assess the ability of models to rely on context rather than lexical cues.
"SQUAD is a large-scale RC dataset organization mentioned in the text for comparison with WIKIHOP and MEDHOP."
"WIKIREADING is an organization that inherits the train, development, and test set splits for WIKIHOP, as mentioned in the text."
"WIKIDATA is a database organization mentioned in the text, which provides type-consistent false answer candidates for the task."
"Fabregat et al. are authors referenced in the text, associated with REACTOME and its citation."
"Percha et al. are authors mentioned in the text, whose work is considered similar to the approach taken in the document."
"Aspirin is a drug mentioned in the text, known to interact with a large number of other drugs."
"Isotretinoin is a drug mentioned in the text, which interacts with fewer other drugs compared to Aspirin."
"Louis Auguste is a historical figure mentioned in the text, with a query example related to his father."
"Louis XIV of France is a historical figure mentioned as the correct answer in a query example involving Louis Auguste."
"West Suffolk is a geographical entity mentioned in the text, used as an example of ambiguity due to hypernymy."
"England is a geographical entity mentioned in the text, related to the example of ambiguity involving West Suffolk."
"French is a geographical entity mentioned in the text, associated with Louis XIV of France."

relationships.description: "Both REACTOME and DRUGBANK are databases that provide information on drug and protein interactions, as referenced in the text."

"WIKIHOP is compared with SQUAD in terms of dataset sizes, indicating a relationship based on scale and complexity."

entities.description: "FastQA is a model initially developed and tested on single-hop RC datasets, utilizing bidirectional LSTMs and attention mechanisms."
"BiDAF is a model that employs iterative conditioning across multiple layers, potentially making it better suited for integrating information across sequences."
"Hermann et al. are researchers who observed the phenomenon of lexical regularities among answers in RC dataset assembly."
WIKIHOP is a dataset used for evaluating model performance in an open-domain setting, with both standard and masked setups to assess the ability of models to rely on context rather than lexical cues.

MEDHOP is a dataset used for evaluating model performance, specifically in the context of drug interactions, with both standard and masked setups to assess the ability of models to rely on context rather than lexical cues.
"Mumbai is a geographical location mentioned as an example in the context of masked candidate expressions."
"TF-IDF is a retrieval baseline used for comparison in the evaluation of models on the WIKIHOP dataset."
"Document-cue is a baseline used to predict samples correctly on both WIKIHOP and MEDHOP datasets."
"SQuAD is a benchmark where the performance of BiDAF and FastQA models is compared, with nearly indistinguishable results."
"RC stands for Reading Comprehension, which is the task for which the models are being evaluated and compared."

relationships.description: "Both FastQA and BiDAF are models compared in the context of their performance on RC datasets, with BiDAF showing stronger performance."
"FastQA is a model evaluated on the WIKIHOP dataset, showing its performance in the context of this event."

"The TF-IDF retrieval baseline is used to evaluate model performance on the MEDHOP dataset."

"The Document-cue baseline is used to predict samples on the MEDHOP dataset."

"FastQA's performance is compared to BiDAF on the SQuAD benchmark, showing nearly indistinguishable results."

entities.description: WIKIHOP is a dataset used for evaluating model performance in an open-domain setting, with both standard and masked setups to assess the ability of models to rely on context rather than lexical cues.

MEDHOP is a dataset used for evaluating model performance, specifically in the context of drug interactions, with both standard and masked setups to assess the ability of models to rely on context rather than lexical cues.
"BiDAF is a neural RC model that leverages cross-document information and shows significant performance drops when documents containing candidate mentions are removed."
"FastQA is a neural RC model that shows slight increases or decreases in performance depending on the dataset, indicating problems with integrating cross-document information."
"FREEBASE is a structured knowledge resource that has been used to assemble large-scale datasets for end-to-end text-based QA."
"WIKIPEDIA is a source used to create large-scale datasets for end-to-end text-based QA, with datasets requiring a combination of multiple independent facts."
"TriviaQA is a dataset that involves multi-step reasoning, with complexity stemming from parsing compositional questions."
"Table 7 presents test accuracy (masked) when only documents containing answer candidates are given, highlighting the impact on model performance."
"The image referred to in the text is associated with Table 7, potentially illustrating the test accuracy data."
"S_q refers to the set of documents leading to the correct answer in the context of examining RC models' performance with only relevant documents."
"The gold chain setup is a scenario where RC models are presented with only relevant documents, leading to significant performance improvements."
"The masking template is a feature in the masked gold chain setup that allows models to achieve almost perfect scores by recognizing its pattern."
"Unrelated documents with type-consistent candidates can introduce noise, affecting the models' answer selection process robustness."
"End-to-end text-based QA has seen a surge in interest due to the advent of large-scale datasets, which are assembled based on various sources."
"The FraCaS test suite is a limited-size multi-hop RC resource, often used for comparison in the field of cross-document RC and multistep inference."
"Weston et al., 2016 is referenced in the context of synthetic language-based multi-hop RC resources."
"Inductive Logic Programming is a method for KB inference, which includes approaches like Quinlan (1990), Pazzani et al. (1991), and Richards and Mooney (1991)."
"Markov Logic is a probabilistic relaxation to logic used for KB inference, with references to Richardson and Domingos (2006) and Schoenmackers et al. (2008)."

"The Path Ranking Algorithm is a scalable approach to composite rule learning, performing random walks to identify salient paths between entities, referenced in the work of Lao and Cohen (2010) and Lao et al. (2011)."
"Gardner et al., 2013 is referenced in the context of circumventing sparsity problems in KB inference methods."

relationships.description: "BiDAF's performance is evaluated in the WIKIHOP setting, showing its ability to leverage cross-document information."
"BiDAF's performance is significantly affected by the masking in the MEDHOP setting, indicating the model's reliance on cross-document information."
"FastQA's performance on WIKIHOP shows slight increases, suggesting it has fewer problems integrating cross-document information compared to BiDAF."
"FastQA's performance on MEDHOP shows a decrease, indicating problems with integrating cross-document information in this setting."
"WIKIHOP is specifically designed for cross-document RC and multistep inference, unlike WIKIPEDIA-based datasets that are confined to single documents."
"MEDHOP, like WIKIHOP, is designed for cross-document RC and multistep inference, contrasting with single-document WIKIPEDIA-based datasets."
"Table 7 is likely accompanied by an image (images/image_7.jpg) that visually represents the data it contains."
"S_q is the set of documents considered in the gold chain setup, which is crucial for evaluating the models' performance with only relevant documents."
"The masking template is particularly relevant in the MEDHOP setting, where it allows models to achieve high scores when only relevant documents are provided."
"WIKIHOP is one of the datasets used in the surge of interest in end-to-end text-based QA, requiring cross-document RC and multistep inference."

entities.description: "Seo et al., 2017a is a research group that proposed a competitive RC model."
"Weissenborn et al., 2017 is a research group that proposed a competitive RC model."
"Jia and Liang, 2017 is a research group referenced for their work on multi-hop reasoning tasks."
"Hermann et al., 2015 is a research group that relied on entity masking in their work."
"Hill et al., 2016 is a research group that relied on entity masking in their work."
"Hanging Gardens of Mumbai is a geo entity used as an example in the dataset assembly process."
"India is a geo entity mentioned as the country related to the Hanging Gardens of Mumbai."
"The cross-document multi-step RC task is a key contribution of the paper, involving information integration across documents."
"A general dataset induction strategy is proposed for constructing multi-hop RC datasets."
"The multi-hop RC task is formally defined in the paper, involving a model given a query, supporting documents, and candidate answers."
"A query is a concept in the multi-hop RC task, representing a question with a set of supporting documents and candidate answers."
"Supporting documents are concept in the multi-hop RC task, providing context for the query and candidate answers."
"Candidate answers are concept in the multi-hop RC task, representing potential answers to the query."
"The correct answer is a concept in the multi-hop RC task, referring to the true answer among the candidate answers."
"Background information is a concept used during dataset assembly but not available to the model."
"A document corpus is a concept representing a collection of documents used in the dataset assembly process."
"KB refers to a knowledge base containing fact triples used in the dataset assembly process."
"Fact triples are concept in the KB, consisting of a subject entity, relation, and object entity."
"A subject entity is a concept in the fact triples, representing the main subject of the fact."
"A relation is a concept in the fact triples, representing the relationship between the subject and object entities."
"An object entity is a concept in the fact triples, representing the object of the fact."
"Query-answer pairs are concept created by transforming KB facts into questions with missing object slots."
"A directed bipartite graph is a concept used to connect documents and entities mentioned in them."
"A document node is a concept in the directed bipartite graph, representing a document in the corpus."
"An entity node is a concept in the directed bipartite graph, representing an entity from the KB."
"Type-consistent answers are concept in the multi-hop RC task, referring to answers that are consistent with the query type."
"End points are concept in the graph traversal process, representing the starting and ending nodes."
"A chain of documents is a concept in the multi-hop RC task, representing a sequence of documents leading from the query subject to the answer candidate."
"Type-consistency heuristics are concept used by models to identify answers based on type consistency."

relationships.description: "Both Seo et al., 2017a and Weissenborn et al., 2017 are organizations that proposed competitive RC models which were evaluated in the text."

"Hermann et al., 2015 and Hill et al., 2016 are both organizations that relied on entity masking, a method contrasted with the approach described in the text."
"The Hanging Gardens of Mumbai is associated with India as its country, as mentioned in the KB fact triple example."

entities.description: The event refers to the publication or research conducted by Schoenmackers and colleagues in 2008 and 2010, addressing limited coverage, inefficient inference, and efforts to circumvent sparsity in approaches.

"The event refers to the publication or research conducted by Narasimhan and colleagues in 2016, related to query reformulation techniques using neural reinforcement learning."
"The event refers to the publication or research conducted by Buck and colleagues in 2018, related to query reformulation techniques using neural reinforcement learning."
"The Allen Distinguished Investigator Award is an organization that supports research and is mentioned as a supporter of the work in the paper."
WIKIHOP is a dataset used for evaluating model performance in an open-domain setting, with both standard and masked setups to assess the ability of models to rely on context rather than lexical cues.

MEDHOP is a dataset used for evaluating model performance, specifically in the context of drug interactions, with both standard and masked setups to assess the ability of models to rely on context rather than lexical cues.
"Random is a baseline model that selects a random candidate for the task, indicating a non-strategic approach to answer prediction."
"Max-mention is a model that predicts the most frequently mentioned candidate in the support documents, breaking ties randomly."
"Majority-candidate-per-query-type is a model that predicts the candidate most frequently observed as the true answer in the training set, based on the query type."
"TF-IDF Retrieval-based models are strong QA baselines that search for individual documents based on keywords in the question, typically not combining information across documents."
"Document-cue is a baseline that predicts the candidate with the highest score across document-answer co-occurrences, indicating the presence of certain documents in the support set."
"FastQA is an LSTM-based extractive QA model that predicts an answer span within a single document and is adapted for a multi-document setting."
"BiDAF, or Bidirectional Attention Flow model, is an LSTM-based extractive QA model that predicts an answer span within a single document and is adapted for multi-document settings."
"Section 5.2 describes the process of validating the test set for MEDHOP, which includes samples labeled by a majority of annotators as 'follows' and requiring multiple documents."
"Section 5.3 is referenced for the evaluation of models on both the full test set and the validated portion of MEDHOP."
"Crowdsourcing is mentioned as a not feasible method for MEDHOP due to the requirement of specialist knowledge."
"Annotators are individuals who label samples for the test set of MEDHOP, with a majority (at least 2 of 3) required to label a sample as 'follows'."
"$20\%$ of the MEDHOP test set was manually annotated to identify samples implying the correct answer and requiring multiple documents."
"Clark et al., 2016 is referenced to support the claim that retrieval-based models are strong QA baselines if candidate answers are provided."
"Welbl et al., 2017 is referenced to support the claim that retrieval-based models are strong QA baselines if candidate answers are provided."
"The whoosh text retrieval engine is used by the TF-IDF model to search for individual documents based on keywords in the question."
"Rajpurkar et al., 2016 is referenced for the method of measuring accuracy based on the exact match between the prediction and answer in the experiments."
"Seo et al., 2017a is referenced for the default hyperparameters used in the implementation of the BiDAF model."
"Pennington et al., 2014 is referenced for the pretrained GloVe embeddings used in both BiDAF and FastQA models."
"Weissenborn et al., 2017 is referenced for the implementation of the FastQA model used in the experiments."

relationships.description: "WIKIHOP and MEDHOP are both datasets used for experiments to evaluate the performance of various models, including baseline models."
"MEDHOP is a dataset on which the Random model is tested to establish performance baselines."
"MEDHOP is a dataset on which the Max-mention model is tested to establish performance baselines."
"MEDHOP is a dataset on which the Majority-candidate-per-query-type model is tested to establish performance baselines."
"MEDHOP is a dataset on which TF-IDF Retrieval-based models are tested to establish performance baselines."
"MEDHOP is a dataset on which the Document-cue model is tested to establish performance baselines."
"MEDHOP is a dataset on which the FastQA model is tested to establish performance baselines."
"MEDHOP is a dataset on which the BiDAF model is tested to establish performance baselines."
"Section 5.2 describes the process where annotators label samples for the validated test set of MEDHOP."
"Section 5.3 involves the evaluation of models on the validated portion of the test set, which includes samples labeled by annotators."
"MEDHOP's test set samples are labeled by annotators, with a majority required to label a sample as 'follows'."
"$20\%$ of the MEDHOP test set was manually annotated for the purpose of identifying samples requiring multiple documents."
"TF-IDF Retrieval-based models use the whoosh text retrieval engine to search for documents based on keywords in the question."

entities.description: "WIKIREADING is a dataset analyzed for biases and errors in the context of dataset creation and analysis."
"Hewlett et al. conducted a limited analysis of the WIKIREADING dataset, which is further analyzed for downstream effects on WIKIHOP."
WIKIHOP is a dataset used for evaluating model performance in an open-domain setting, with both standard and masked setups to assess the ability of models to rely on context rather than lexical cues.

MEDHOP is a dataset used for evaluating model performance, specifically in the context of drug interactions, with both standard and masked setups to assess the ability of models to rely on context rather than lexical cues.
"Cohen and Hunter are authors who noted the exponential growth in the number of publications in molecular biology, influencing the creation of the MEDHOP dataset."
"Hirschman et al. contributed to research efforts in Information Extraction (IE) for biomedical text, relevant to the construction of the MEDHOP dataset."
"Kim et al. are researchers whose work in Information Extraction (IE) is related to the construction of the MEDHOP dataset."
"Hersh et al. conducted research in Question Answering (QA) for biomedical text, influencing the development of the MEDHOP dataset."
"Nentidis et al. are researchers whose work on diverse query types in RC datasets is relevant to the MEDHOP dataset construction."
"Gurulingappa et al. focused on explicit mentions of Drug-Drug Interactions (DDIs) in single sentences, contributing to the understanding of DDIs relevant to MEDHOP."
"Percha et al. are researchers whose work on DDIs is related to the MEDHOP dataset, focusing on explicit mentions of interactions."
"Segura-Bedmar et al. are researchers who have worked on explicit mentions of Drug-Drug Interactions (DDIs), relevant to the MEDHOP dataset."
"Peng et al. showed that cross-sentence relation extraction increases the number of available relations, influencing the approach taken in MEDHOP."
"Swanson is associated with the concept of inferring scientific discoveries from established public knowledge, relevant to the promise of multi-hop methods in MEDHOP."
"Leuprolide is a drug mentioned in the context of causing GnRH receptor-induced synaptic potentiations and is part of the PPI chains relevant to MEDHOP."
"Progonadoliberin-1 is a protein that can block the effects of Leuprolide, as mentioned in the context of Drug-Drug Interactions (DDIs) in MEDHOP."
"Triptorelin is a drug that is a superagonist of the protein Progonadoliberin-1, suggesting an interaction with Leuprolide as described in MEDHOP."

"Wikipedia is a free online encyclopedia containing a vast amount of multi-domain information and structured resources like infoboxes and Wikidata."
"Wikidata is a structured knowledge base that is associated with Wikipedia and contains data in the form of entities, properties, and values."
"Morales et al. are researchers who have used Wikipedia to build datasets for querying single sentences."
"Levy et al. are researchers who have used Wikipedia to build datasets for querying single sentences."
"Yang et al. are researchers who have used Wikipedia to build datasets for querying single articles."
"Hewlett et al. are researchers who proposed the Wikireading RC dataset and have used Wikipedia for their research."
"Rajpurkar et al. are researchers who have used Wikipedia to build datasets for querying single articles."
"Hermann et al. are researchers who rely on entity masking in their work, contrasting with the approach of introducing alternative candidates."
"Hill et al. are researchers who rely on entity masking in their work, contrasting with the approach of introducing alternative candidates."
"Vrandeˇci´c is associated with the creation or development of Wikidata."
"Wikireading is a recently proposed RC dataset where Wikidata tuples are aligned with Wikipedia articles regarding their item."
"London is a city whose article in Wikipedia is often associated with the United Kingdom as the correct answer, independent of the query."
"The United Kingdom is a country that is frequently the correct answer when the article about London is present in the dataset."
"The United States is a country whose articles were omitted from the dataset to avoid bias towards a majority class baseline."
"Hill et al. (2016) conducted research that relied on entity masking, which is contrasted with the approach of introducing alternative candidates."
WIKIHOP is a dataset used for evaluating model performance in an open-domain setting, with both standard and masked setups to assess the ability of models to rely on context rather than lexical cues.
"Assembly refers to the process of creating a multi-hop dataset with Wikipedia as the document corpus and Wikidata as structured knowledge triples."
"Mitigating Dataset refers to the process of addressing spurious correlations between candidates and documents in the multi-document setting."
"France is an example of a country used in the set of type-consistent candidate expressions for the WIKIDATA property country."
"Russia is an example of a country used in the set of type-consistent candidate expressions for the WIKIDATA property country."
"Hanging Gardens of Mumbai is an entity used in the example query, with the property 'country' and an unknown answer."
"S_q refers to the set of documents in the query, which are highlighted in yellow in the provided figure."
"C_q refers to the set of candidates in the query, which are indicated by a check or cross for correctness in the provided figure."
"In the context of WIKIDATA tuples, 'item' refers to the subject of the triple, which is used to form the query q."
"In the context of WIKIDATA tuples, 'property' refers to the attribute of the triple, which is used to form the query q."
"In the context of WIKIDATA tuples, 'answer' refers to the object of the triple, which is the goal of the query to predict."
"Majority class baseline refers to a model that predicts the most common class, which would be successful but uninformative for multi-hop reasoning."

relationships.description: "Wikipedia and Wikidata are associated with each other, with Wikidata providing structured resources for Wikipedia."
"Wikireading is an RC dataset that aligns Wikidata tuples with Wikipedia articles regarding their item."
"Wikireading uses Wikidata tuples (item, property, answer) to define a slot filling task with Wikipedia articles."
"Morales et al. have used Wikipedia to build datasets for querying single sentences."
"Levy et al. have used Wikipedia to build datasets for querying single sentences."
"Yang et al. have used Wikipedia to build datasets for querying single articles."
"Hewlett et al. proposed the Wikireading RC dataset and have used Wikipedia for their research."
"WIKIHOP is an attempt to construct a cross-document multi-step RC dataset based on Wikipedia."
"WIKIHOP uses Wikidata as a structured knowledge source to construct the multi-step RC dataset."
"Assembly uses Wikipedia as the document corpus to create a multi-hop dataset."
"Assembly uses Wikidata as structured knowledge triples to create a multi-hop dataset."
"Mitigating Dataset addresses the issue of spurious correlations in the multi-document setting, using Wikipedia as the document source."
